═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: Webpage / Online book (classical work)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: Author not clearly formatted
   What’s wrong: The organization author is not shown as a proper corporate author. "I King James Bible Online" is presented as site name rather than as the author. If the website is the author, it should appear as the corporate author.
   Should be: **King James Bible Online.**

❌ Date: missing comma/parentheses punctuation and/or missing full date
   What’s wrong: The year is not inside parentheses with proper punctuation and the instruction requests year, month day if available.
   Should be: **(2017, Month Day)** — e.g., **(2017, January 1)** if the full date is known. If only year is known, **(2017).**

❌ Order/placement of elements and original-work note
   What’s wrong: The original-work publication information is appended at the end in an inconsistent way. For classical works/reprints, the original publication year is placed after the title in parentheses.
   Should be: **King James Bible Online. (2017). _King James Bible_ (Original work published 1769). https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/** 
   Note: If the author and website name are identical, omit the site name (do not repeat it).

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

CITATION #8
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Stobbe, M. (2020, January 8). Cancer Death Rate in U.S. Sees Largest One-Year Drop Ever. _Chicago Tribune_

SOURCE TYPE: Newspaper article

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Title capitalization
   What’s wrong: Article title should be in sentence case, not headline/title case.
   Should be: **Stobbe, M. (2020, January 8). _Cancer death rate in U.S. sees largest one-year drop ever_. _Chicago Tribune_.**

❌ Missing URL or page information
   What’s wrong: No URL (for an online article) or page number (for print). APA requires a URL for online newspaper articles or page numbers for print articles.
   Should be: **Add the article URL** (e.g., **https://www.chicagotribune.com/...**) OR, if print, add the page reference (e.g., **p. A1**).

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

SOURCE TYPE: White paper / Report

VALIDATION RESULTS:

   What’s wrong: Missing comma after the first author’s initials and before the ampersand.
   Should be: **Furst, M., & DeMillo, R. A. (2006). _Creating symphonic-thinking computer science graduates for an increasingly competitive global environment_ [White paper]. Georgia Tech College of Computing. https://cis.temple.edu/~giorgio/threads_whitepaper.pdf**

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #11
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
joachimr., & smithj. (2019, November 19). We are relying on APA as our university style format - the university is located in Germany (Kassel). So I [Comment on the blog post “The transition to seventh edition APA Style”]. _APA Style_. https://apastyle.apa.org/blog/transition-seventh-edition#comment-4694866690

SOURCE TYPE: Comment on a blog post

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author formatting
   What’s wrong: Authors are presented as two lowercase usernames joined by an ampersand; a single comment normally has a single author. Usernames should be presented exactly as they appear (case-sensitive) and there should not be an ampersand unless there are actually two authors.
   Should be (if the commenter is a single user "joachimr."): **joachimr. (2019, November 19).**  
   Or, if the commenter is "smithj." only, use that single name. If the comment had two authors, list them as two separate names in the normal author format.

❌ Title and bracketed note formatting
   What’s wrong: The comment text is used as the reference title but the bracketed description is not formatted correctly. The bracketed description should immediately follow the comment title.
   Should be: **joachimr. (2019, November 19). We are relying on APA as our university style format - the university is located in Germany (Kassel). So I [Comment on the blog post "The transition to seventh edition APA Style"]. _APA Style_. https://apastyle.apa.org/blog/transition-seventh-edition#comment-4694866690**

❌ Capitalization / quotation marks
   What’s wrong: The blog-post title inside the bracket should be in title case or presented exactly as the post title and enclosed in double quotation marks.
   Should be: **[Comment on the blog post "The transition to Seventh Edition APA Style"]** (use the exact post title and capitalization from the blog).

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #12
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Evans, A. C., Jr., Garbarino, J., Bocanegra, E., Kinscherff, R. T., & Márquez-Greene, N. (2019, August 8–11). _Gun violence: An event on the power of community_ [Conference presentation]. APA 2019 Convention, Chicago, IL, USA. doi:10.1037/con2019-1234

SOURCE TYPE: Conference presentation

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Title formatting (italics)
   What’s wrong: The title of a conference presentation should NOT be italicized; only titles of stand-alone works (books, reports) are italicized.
   Should be: **Evans, A. C., Jr., Garbarino, J., Bocanegra, E., Kinscherff, R. T., & Márquez-Greene, N. (2019, August 8–11). Gun violence: An event on the power of community [Conference presentation]. APA 2019 Convention, Chicago, IL, USA. https://doi.org/10.1037/con2019-1234**

❌ DOI format
   What’s wrong: The DOI is given without the https://doi.org/ prefix (APA 7 recommends the DOI as a URL).
   Should be: **https://doi.org/10.1037/con2019-1234**

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Price D. (2018, March 23). _laziness does not exist_. Medium https://humanparts.medium.com/laziness-does-not-exist-3af27e312d01

SOURCE TYPE: Blog post (Medium)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author punctuation
   What’s wrong: Missing comma after the author's last name and missing period after the initial.
   Should be: **Price, D. (2018, March 23).**

❌ Title formatting / italics
   What’s wrong: Article titles (blog posts) should NOT be italicized and the first word should be capitalized (sentence case).
   Should be: **Price, D. (2018, March 23). Laziness does not exist. Medium. https://humanparts.medium.com/laziness-does-not-exist-3af27e312d01**

❌ Missing period between site name and URL

CITATION #14
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
American Psychiatric Association. (1987). Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders, Third Edition, Revised.

SOURCE TYPE: Book (DSM — third edition, revised)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Title italics and sentence-case / edition formatting / publisher
   What’s wrong: The title should be italicized and presented in sentence case; the edition should be in parentheses following the title in abbreviated form. Also publisher information is missing or needs to be handled correctly (if author = publisher, do not repeat publisher).
   Should be: **American Psychiatric Association. (1987). _Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders_ (3rd ed., rev.).**  
   If a publisher is required and different from the author, add it. If author = publisher, omit the publisher name.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #15
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Belcher, W (2019). _Writing Your Journal Article in Twelve Weeks: A Guide to Academic Publishing Success_ (2nd ed) University of Chicago Press.

SOURCE TYPE: Book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author punctuation
   What’s wrong: Missing comma after author’s last name and missing period after initial.
   Should be: **Belcher, W. (2019).**

❌ Title case and italics / sentence case
   What’s wrong: Book titles should be in sentence case (only the first word and proper nouns capitalized), and the title should be italicized (in the reference it is marked italic but uses title case).
   Should be: **_Writing your journal article in twelve weeks: A guide to academic publishing success_**

❌ Edition punctuation and publisher separation
   What’s wrong: Edition parentheses and punctuation are missing a closing period and a period before the publisher.
   Should be: **(2nd ed.). University of Chicago Press.**

Full corrected form example:
**Belcher, W. (2019). _Writing your journal article in twelve weeks: A guide to academic publishing success_ (2nd ed.). University of Chicago Press.**

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #17
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Occupational Safety & Health Administration. (1970). _Occupational safety and health standards: Occupational health & environmental control: Occupational noise exposure_ (OSHA Standard No. 1910.95), United States Department of Labor. https://www.osha.gov/laws-regs/regulations/standardnumber/1910/1910.95

SOURCE TYPE: Government standard / web

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Organization name (ampersand)
   What’s wrong: Official agency name uses "and" rather than an ampersand in running text; the formal name is "Occupational Safety and Health Administration."
   Should be: **Occupational Safety and Health Administration. (1970).**

❌ Publisher/agency attribution
   What’s wrong: The presentation of "United States Department of Labor" after the standard is confusing. If the corporate author is the agency that published the document, do not repeat the publisher. If the publisher is a different organizational body, format it clearly.
   Should be: If OSHA is the author and publisher, omit the publisher. Example corrected form:
   **Occupational Safety and Health Administration. (1970). _Occupational safety and health standards: Occupational health and environmental control: Occupational noise exposure_ (OSHA Standard No. 1910.95). https://www.osha.gov/…**

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Butler, J. (2017). Where access meets multimodality: The case of ASL music videos. _Kairos: A Journal of Rhetoric, Technology, and Pedagogy_, _21_(1). http://technorhetoric.net/21.1/topoi/butler/index.html

SOURCE TYPE: Journal article (online)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

Note: No page numbers are provided; that is acceptable for some online journals that use article-level organization. URL is included.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #19
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
American Psychiatric Association (1994) Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (4th ed.) https://doi.org/10.1176/appi.books.9780890420614.dsm-iv

SOURCE TYPE: Book (DSM-4)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Missing punctuation around year and author formatting
   What’s wrong: Year should be in parentheses following the author and followed by a period.
   Should be: **American Psychiatric Association. (1994).**

❌ Title italics and sentence-case / edition formatting
   What’s wrong: Title must be italicized and in sentence case; the edition should be in parentheses immediately after the title.
   Should be: **_Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders_ (4th ed.).**

❌ DOI formatting punctuation
   What’s wrong: A period is needed before the DOI if the reference sentence ends there; APA 7 prefers the DOI as a URL.
   Should be: **https://doi.org/10.1176/appi.books.9780890420614.dsm-iv**

Full corrected example:
**American Psychiatric Association. (1994). _Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders_ (4th ed.). https://doi.org/10.1176/appi.books.9780890420614.dsm-iv**

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #20
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Nguyen, T., Carnevale, J. J., Scholer, A. A., Miele, D. B., & Fujita, K. (2019). Metamotivational knowledge of the role of high-level and low-level construal in goal-relevant task performance. _Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 117_(5), 879-899. http://dx.doi.org/10.1037/pspa0000166

SOURCE TYPE: Journal article

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

Note: As a minor stylistic update, APA 7 prefers the DOI displayed as a URL beginning with https://doi.org/… (e.g., **https://doi.org/10.1037/pspa0000166**), but the provided DOI is acceptable.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

If you want, I can produce corrected full-reference entries for any of the citations above in ready-to-use APA 7th edition form.







═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
American Psychiatric Association (2013). Anxiety disorders. In _Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders_ (5th ed.). https://doi.org/10.1176/appi.books.9780890425596.dsm05

SOURCE TYPE: Book chapter / book entry

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Publisher: Publisher name is missing.
   Should be: American Psychiatric Association. (2013). Anxiety disorders. In _Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders_ (5th ed.). **American Psychiatric Publishing.** https://doi.org/10.1176/appi.books.9780890425596.dsm05

(Note: If citing the DSM-5 as a whole authored book by the APA, the publisher should be included as shown. If this is intended as a book-as-a-whole citation, you may omit the chapter title and cite the book itself.)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #2
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Thestrup, K. (2010). To transform, to communicate, to play—The experimenting community in action. In Hygum, E. & Pedersen, P. M., (Eds.), _Early childhood education: Values and practices in Denmark_. Hans Reitzels Forlag. https://earlychildhoodeducation.digi.hansreitzel.dk/?id=192

SOURCE TYPE: Book chapter

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Chapter title (capitalization): Title uses an uppercase "The" after an em dash; APA requires sentence case.
   Should be: _To transform, to communicate, to play— the experimenting community in action._

❌ Editors (name order and punctuation): Editors are given as "Hygum, E. & Pedersen, P. M., (Eds.)," — APA requires initials before surnames and no extra comma before (Eds.).
   Should be: In **E. Hygum & P. M. Pedersen (Eds.),**

❌ Overall formatting (placement of editors): The "In" phrase should be followed directly by the editors in the correct format.
   Correct full example: Thestrup, K. (2010). _To transform, to communicate, to play— the experimenting community in action._ In **E. Hygum & P. M. Pedersen (Eds.), _Early childhood education: Values and practices in Denmark_**. Hans Reitzels Forlag. https://earlychildhoodeducation.digi.hansreitzel.dk/?id=192

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

   Should be: Harris, L. (2014). _Instructional leadership perceptions and practices of elementary school leaders_ [Unpublished doctoral dissertation]. **University of Virginia.**

Schlesselmann, A. J., & Held, P. (2025). Using network analysis to characterize clinical improvement during cognitive processing therapy. _Behaviour Research and Therapy, 185_, Article 104678. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.brat.2024.104678

CITATION #9
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Scruton, R. (1996) _The eclipse of listening_ The New Criterion, 15(3), 5–13.

SOURCE TYPE: Journal article / magazine article

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Punctuation after year: Missing period after the year parentheses.
   Should be: Scruton, R. (1996).

❌ Article title formatting: The article title is incorrectly italicized and should be in plain text (sentence case).
   Should be: _The eclipse of listening_ → **The eclipse of listening.**

❌ Missing punctuation between title and journal: There should be a period after the article title, then the journal name (italicized).
   Correct full example: Scruton, R. (1996). **The eclipse of listening.** _The New Criterion, 15_(3), 5–13.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #10
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Elders, M. (2019). Neighborhood watch: Social media in the community. In M. Elders (Ed.), _POL 241: Politics and activism in the 21st century_ (pp. 34–41). American University.

SOURCE TYPE: Book chapter (author is same as editor)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author/editor duplication: The chapter author and the book editor are the same person. APA advises that when the author of a chapter is also the editor of the book, you should not include the editor element; instead cite the book as a whole (or treat as the author of the book).
   Should be (as the book): Elders, M. (2019). _POL 241: Politics and activism in the 21st century_ (pp. 34–41). **American University.**

(If you intended to cite just a chapter by a different author in an edited volume, include the editor(s) in the "In" phrase. Here they are the same person, so remove the "In M. Elders (Ed.)," construction.)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #11
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
McNally, R. J., & Held, P. (2025). Using Network Analysis to Characterize Clinical Improvement During Cognitive Processing Therapy. _Behaviour Research and Therapy_, _185_, Article 104678.

SOURCE TYPE: Journal article

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Title capitalization: The article title is in headline/title case; APA 7 requires sentence case for article titles.
   Should be: _Using Network Analysis to Characterize Clinical Improvement During Cognitive Processing Therapy_ → **Using network analysis to characterize clinical improvement during cognitive processing therapy.**

❌ DOI missing: The citation omits the article DOI/URL. A DOI is available and should be included.
   Should be appended, e.g.: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.brat.2024.104678

Corrected full example: McNally, R. J., & Held, P. (2025). **Using network analysis to characterize clinical improvement during cognitive processing therapy.** _Behaviour Research and Therapy, 185_, Article 104678. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.brat.2024.104678

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #12
